Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I really didn't think I was going to have a good time, but I did. Totally did.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I love camping. [in a singing voice] Anything can happen.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, it wasn't camping, it was more of a wilderness retreat. [Michael walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Morning.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ryan invited some of the branch managers and Toby into the woods for a "get to know you" weekend. Michael wasn't invited. Apparently they already knew everything they needed to know about him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you sleep in cabins?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Under the stars. It was really beautiful, you should come.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Bob and I took rock climbing lessons once. [Michael laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael wasn't invited on Ryan's camping trip. Toby went, but Michael didn't go. He wasn't invited.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who went?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Me, Dan from Buffalo, Mark Chisholm, Jeff from Albany and Ryan, obviously. Made so many s'mores, that I finally had to say, "No more s'mores, no more s'mores." [everyone in room but Michael laughs, Michael exits break room]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ryan invited me to go on his wilderness adventure retreat. It was this amazing, beautiful experience [Michael knocks on the window behind Toby from outside]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [from outside] Hey, nobody cares. Nobody cares. I need that room at some point, so just, wrap it up.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael wasn't invited.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hypothetically, if I were to ask you to go camping, and you know what hypothetical means? [Jim makes a face] Not real.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So if I were to hypothetically ask you to go camping with me, would you go?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When Michael plays the hypothetical game, I always say yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you wanna go today?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I am always busy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, can't go today, 'cause I'm donating blood.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How often can you actually donate blood?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is there a limit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your body only has a certain amount.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, is that it? Or?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, just this whole Toby, camping thing, uh, seems a little lame.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How so?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A bunch of guys, in a tent? Making s'mores? [makes a noise and gestures with his hands]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, I'm Broken Mountain. You know, here's the thing. That's not how you go camping. I think you go camping by yourself--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In the wilderness. It's not with a group of guys frolicking around in tents. It's one guy, or two guys, if your plans change.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not gonna change.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wanna do it myself. You know, I want to go and, and find out something about myself, I wanna get outta here. All the cliques, and the office politics. Fluorescent lights. Asbestos.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought we had that looked at.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sick of it Jim. I'm sick of this place.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When Jan and I had satellite, we used to watch a reality show called "Survivorman." And, it was interesting because it was about a guy who would go out in the middle of no where and just try not to die, try not to get eaten by an animal, or be overexposed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, I will only need two things. Roll of duct tape and a knife.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [winks] I'm on it. [leaves room]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. Thirty minutes or less, please come back. Save the receipts. [Dwight comes back with set of knives] Hey, what...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's see if any of these will work. [clears the front of Michael's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey hey! Dwight. [Dwight rolls out an assortment knives]. Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I keep various weaponries strategically placed around the office. I saved Jim's life with a can of pepper spray I had velcroed under my desk. People say, "Oh, it's dangerous to keep weapons in the home or the work place." Well I say, "It's better to be hurt by someone you know accidentally, than by a stranger on purpose."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight and I are going out. He will return later, but I will not. I will also be taking a personal day tomorrow, and perhaps the next day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you want me to ask where you're going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight will be driving me deep into the Pennsylvania wilderness.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where he will then leave me to either die or to survive. The choice is yours.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm, no, the choice is actually yours. Are you sure you want to do this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, and I am leaving you in charge of the office for the rest of the day and for the next several days. Do not try to follow me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is a very personal, private experience in the wild, that I wish to share it with me, myself and I.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I return, I hope to be a completely changed human being.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That'd be great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do I believe that Michael possesses the skills to survive in a hostile environment? Let's put it this way:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is what a true survivor man does. You simulate a disaster, like a plane wreck. You could only wear the clothes that you have on, and you could only use the stuff you have in your pockets. Now, in this case, this disaster is a serial killer. Creepy guy who's abducted me and is taking me out into the wilderness to leave me for dead.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I would never leave you for dead. You would never escape.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, yes I would. And I would survive.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would make sure that you were dead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: First, I would remove your teeth and cut off your fingertips so you could not be identified.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And they would call me the Overkill Killer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You... you are as creepy as a real serial killer. For real. [blindfolds eyes with tie] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am putting this on so I have no familiarity with my surroundings. Now this way, I can't retrace my steps. I don't know what streets we've been-- [Dwight whacks Michael with his shoe] Ow! What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It would be better if you were unconscious.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! Gosh! Dwight. [Dwight tries to hit Michael with his shoe again] Stop it, stop it! Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you want to do this right or not?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just, please allow me to have one cathartic experience in my life?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Jim, we need to order a cake for Creed's birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, wasn't it just someone's birthday?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes. Kelly's was last week, remember?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I do remember, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's birthday month. Creed's is today. Oscar's is week after next. Meredith's is at the end of the month. [Jim exhales deeply] Michael usually goes with red and white streamers...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what, I have an idea. Why don't we just do one big shared party?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There are thirteen people working in this office, so thirteen times a year Michael gets a cake and balloons, and some sort of joke gift and makes a toast. There are two types of toasts. One is a joke about how old you are.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [flashback to Stanley's birthday] Look at those wrinkles. Blacks do crack! Not crack the drug.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And the other is something inappropriate. Or horrible. Or both. What else? He only sings the high harmony to "Happy Birthday." And he's a very big believer in surprise parties. Maybe even, arguably, possibly to a fault.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [flashback to Kelly's birthday, hiding in the elevator] Happy Birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ahhh!! [drops the papers she was holding]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [flashback to Oscar's birthday, hiding in the break room] Happy Birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ahhh! [runs into door and Michael laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [flashback to Phyllis' birthday, sneaking up on Phyllis' car] Happy Birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh! [Michael laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So... I think, yeah, I think getting these out of the way might be productive.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We can just have one big fun party. Everybody's happy, nobody wastes their time.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't like it. [Angela leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow! You're shaking things up a bit, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's a pretty good idea, don't you think?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you think it's a good idea?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No... I think it's a great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [smiles] Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We're here. [gets out of the car]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight will take my blindfold off when we are deep in the forest. Just the two of us from this point out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [leading Michael from car] Here we go. Just the two of us [gestures for camera crew to follow]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here we go, into the wild. Mighty forest. Can you smell the trees and the nature?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Keep going, you're fine. Just some bushes and some thickets [leads Michael into some tall grass] Keep going. You wanted wilderness, you got it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, try sending them another invoice.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. [starts walking away, but returns] Oh, did you see my memo by the way?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [picks up and reads memo] "Let's be honest, as fun as birthdays are we could all use a break from the constant cake, so let's celebrate birthday month in style today." This is really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right? I was just thinking...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, totally, totally. This way we get it all out of the way at once and it could actually be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right! Exactly. [pats Oscar on the back and walks away] Knew I could count on you. [Oscar rolls his eyes]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good a spot as any. [They stop and Dwight starts spinning Michael around in circles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing? Stop. Dwight, Dwight. Just --

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm just --

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Spin. I'm trying to confuse your sense of direction. [stops spinning and takes Michael's blindfold off] Behold.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, good. Thank you, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here's your knife. Here's your duct tape.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, very good. Ahh, OK. [Dwight gives Michael a hug]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good luck, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks for the ride. OK. Leave me be, Dwight. [Dwight runs off]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim, can I have my own cake?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I really prefer devils food cake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. [Meredith leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow! That was easy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, people like me I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [knocking from outside window in break room] Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I hate devils food.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well I think Meredith was just --

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Screw Meredith, I don't think it's fair to let someone else pick the cake on my birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Everybody's birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Today is actually my birthday and I want to pick the cake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I want pie. I want peach pie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You want a birthday pie?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I want a nice cobbler.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I'm gonna to talk to Angela and we're gonna see what we can do about a pie.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I don't care who you talk to. Just make it happen.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It will be Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You tell her it's for Creed. She'll know what that means.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to own camcorder] Day One. I'm in the interior of the vast Pennsylvania wilderness. I've brought with me only the bare essentials. A knife, roll of duct tape, in case I need to craft some shelter or make some sort of water vessel. It's hot today. The sun is in the two-thirds easterly quadrant, which would make it about [looks at watch] 2 o'clock in the afternoon. It's really beating down on me now. I think that I want to get a little more comfortable because the sun is depleting my resources. [cuts pants with knife] OK. OH, there we go. Watch that I don't hit my corroded artery here...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I lied to Michael. I said that I would leave him alone, but I will not. I will remain close by to provide unseen moral support, but I will never help him. I will let harm befall him. I will even let him die. But I will never let him lose his dignity.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There we go. [standing with short sleeves and short pants] Much better. Now everything I brought with me can be used. My sport coat here, can be fashioned into a backpack of sorts [ties jacket around neck].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to wear what was once one of my pant legs. [puts pant leg on head like a hat]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See, this is a beautiful piece of material [rips other pant leg in half] This could be used for all sorts of things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Some sort of kerchief to keep my neck nice and comfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna. [rolls in chair to Jim's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Me likey the ice cream cake, okay? Fudgie the Whale.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not your birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I'm just saying, you know, if you want to make people happy, namely me, you will have a Fudgie the Whale.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, I'll look into it, but the answer's no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow, OK, harsh. Just don't expect me to show up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy, I have some calls to make.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Loud and clear. [rolls in chair back to desk]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. [Andy rolls back]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pizza rolls.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, I'm gonna go into this office here [gets up and walks into Michael's office] to do some work. So I will be in here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mushroom caps.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am totally alone right now, with only my thoughts. I love it. I'm loving it. I can literally say anything I want. No one is gonna here me. [screams] Wish I could have gone with Ryan on that cool retreat! Jan has plastic boobs! I HAVE HEMORRHOIDS! Doesn't even matter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael is a man of great depth and passion. I don't know what he's searching for out here. [pulls a nest from a tree] I hope he finds it. [picks up some bird eggs] Lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well it is a little chillier than I had thought, so I have fashioned my hat back into my pants. Several hours in, time for me to find some nourishment. Now, these woods are full of creatures that can sustain human life. Things like, uh, squirrels, nice juicy rabbit would be delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: About two more minutes [cooking bird eggs].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have made this spear, with which I will impale my dinner. And it couldn't come a moment too soon because I have been without food for a good three hours or so. I'm startin' to feel it a little bit. Ohh... It's Creed's birthday. [singing] Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to Creed. Happy Birthday to you. Happy birthday, buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What is Jim thinking? It's a birthday, so what if there's a lot of them?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I work hard all day. I like knowing that there's going to be a break. Most days I just sit and wait for the break.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I took an extra shot of insulin in preparation for this cake today. If I don't have some cake soon, I might die.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why don't you just have an apple?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why don't you mind your business?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Listen, I figured this out. Jimmy had his birthday three weeks ago, so he doesn't care.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Probably went to his head.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Jim enters room]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey guys, what're we talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Nothing! Nothing going on. We're talking about nothing. C'mon gang.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well if you take a look at this, I tented my pants. I've made myself a nice pants tent shelter. And this little guy [pats a large tree trunk] may be Dunder Mifflin paper some day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nothing to worry about. Just using the scope. Safety is... [clicks rifle into safety mode] on.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [knocks] Hey Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, I just got the word on the communal birthdays. Great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks man.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is there anything --

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: My birthday was two months ago.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, OK.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: There was no party.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, it... there was. But Michael scheduled it for 4:58 on a Friday. You know, people sang in the parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I remember that.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't know, I just thought you could include me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I just though you could add me. I don't see the harm in that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Toby's great. He's great, but sometimes he can be a little bit much. [in Toby voice] I don't see the harm in that. Well, it's a cake Toby, so, c'mon.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. Yeah, you know what, we're just gonna throw you in. Because more the merrier, right?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. No way. I am not a machine, Jim. You can't just change plans willy nilly and expect these little magic party elves to do your bidding. We already have devils food, peach cobbler, Fudgie the Whale, mushroom caps.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm allergic to mushrooms.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's a bummer. OK, then we need to...[steps outside office] Hey everybody. Hi, how you doing? Can I have your attention please? 'Cause we have to talk about this birthday thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [raises hand] Conference room?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, conference room in five minutes... No. No. We're gonna solve it right here. We're actually gonna talk about it out here. So, who has problems with the birthday thing? [everyone raises hands] One, two, three, everybody. OK, so then we just shouldn't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What am I supposed to do with two cakes and a pie?'

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I'll take 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Well nobody's touching my cobbler.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [raises hand] Hey, Michael. I mean Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup, Phyllis called me Michael. And I will always and forever be haunted by that fact.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Under this tree, I think I struck the mother load. Those [points camera to mushrooms] are nature's best mushrooms. Wild, and I have to say these little buggers are damn tasty as well. [puts them in mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stop! No, no Michael! Nooo! Nooo! [runs up to Michael and knocks him over] Nooo! Arghh. Get, get them out. [picks out mushrooms from Michael's mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday [Michael joins in with high note] to Creed. Happy Birthday to you. [Creed blows up candles on pie]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! [everybody clapping] Alright, skip around the room. Skip around the room. We want -- OK, alright. Yeah, don't do that. You're gonna break something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Man became civilized for a reason. He decided that he liked to have warmth, and clothing, and television, and hamburgers, and to walk upright, and to have a soft futon at the end of the day. He didn't want to have to struggle to survive. I don't need the woods. I have a nice wood desk. I don't need fresh air, because I have the freshest air around, A.C. And I don't need wide open spaces. Check it out. [shows off computer screen scenery] I can also make it the sky.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure glad you're back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are relieved.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So what did I miss?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I tried to put all the birthdays together at once.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, terrible idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, okay, I did that. Rookie mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You did do it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh. Yeah, just wait. Ten years, you'll figure it out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I don't think I'll be here in ten years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what I said. That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's what who said?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I never know. I just say it. I say stuff like that, you know, to lighten the tension. When things sort of get hard.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Nice. Really good. Bravo, my young ward.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come in!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, it's Creed's birthday today. Should we get him an ice-cream cake? Mint chocolate chip?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, are you my friend?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have been friends forever, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, I have been working with you forever.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hypothetically... would you go camping with me, if I were to ask you? And bear in mind that I would never actually ask you to go camping. That Jim is also a friend of mine, and I would rather die than make any sort of improper ovation toward you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here's the thing. When Michael invents a hypothetical situation, he eventually turns it into an actual situation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you understand that Jim is like a brother to me, and I would never do anything inappropriate?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, as friends, would you go with me on a camping trip?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you for your honesty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're welcome. Open or closed?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Split the difference. Hey... mint chocolate chip, please? Is Jim out there?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you send Dwight in here?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Dwight, Michael wants to see you in his office. [Dwight runs in]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanted to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhmm. I had something very personal I would like to discuss. [Dwight closes door, takes off glasses, kneels in front of Michael's desk] Would you go find Jim, and send him in here, please?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm on it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael has employed Dwight to track you down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How much time do I have?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, Michael's office.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Couple minutes, give or take.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now, Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And this... is a Hassenfass. Case-hardened steel. One side, as sharp as you'd ever want something to be. The other side serrated for maximum damage.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look at that. Perfectly balanced. This is a fine precision instrument.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, Dexter, just give me the knife.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't you want a sheath for that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, just get me a case. [Dwight looks at the camera, lifts his leg onto the desk, removes the sheath from his ankle, and gives it to Michael] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Anything else? Flint...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: MmMmm. All I need...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Parka...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Tent, rainfly, gorp...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm telling you, all I will need are my instincts and my will to survive.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmmnnnnmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding up knife] What is this called again?
